properties.Title: Extreme Cold Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Wind chills near minus 30 will continue for portions of the area early this morning before temperatures moderate. Wind chills near minus 30 may occur again tonight into Sunday morning. ### Risks are greater for young children, older adults, people with chronic illnesses, people working or exercising outdoors, and those without proper shelter. Watch for cold related symptoms: shortness of breath, chest pain, muscle pain and weakness, numbness and colour change in fingers and toes. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2021-01-31T01:56:49-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-01-30T09:57:49-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1182500175.2021
Area: Belleville - Quinte West - Eastern Northumberland County, Cobourg - Colborne - Western Northumberland County, Tamworth - Sydenham - South Frontenac, Stirling - Tweed - Madoc, Kingston - Odessa - Frontenac Islands, Napanee - Consecon, Fenelon Falls - Balsam Lake Park - Northern Kawartha Lakes, Apsley - Woodview - Northern Peterborough County, Lindsay - Southern Kawartha Lakes, Peterborough City - Lakefield - Southern Peterborough County
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Winter Storm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Hazardous winter conditions are expected. Further snowfall: up to 15 cm. Maximum wind gusts: northwest to north 60 to 70 km/h. Locations: Postville - Makkovik. Time span: continuing through this evening. Remarks: Makkovik has received near 15 cm of snow with a further 5 to 15 cm expected today and this evening. This snow will be accompanied by moderate to strong northerly winds, which will give poor visibility in snow and blowing snow. Conditions are expected to improve tonight. ### Visibility may be suddenly reduced at times in heavy snow. Winter storm warnings are issued when multiple types of severe winter weather are expected to occur together. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2021-01-30T22:59:11-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-01-30T14:38:11-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2316409839.2021
Area: Postville - Makkovik
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Winter Storm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Hazardous winter conditions are expected. A series of Pacific weather systems will bring snow to the mountain parks regions, specifically Highway 93. Snow is expected to start on Sunday with 25 to 30 cm of snow expected by Monday morning. Another Pacific system will bring more snow beginning Monday overnight with a further 10 to 20 cm of snow expected by Tuesday evening. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ABstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ABStorm.
Expires: 2021-01-31T14:29:09-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-01-30T22:30:09-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1315079114.2021
Area: Highway 93 - Lake Louise to Saskatchewan River Crossing, Highway 93 - Jasper to Saskatchewan River Crossing
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Blowing Snow Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Poor visibility in snow and blowing snow is expected or occurring in some locations. Total snowfall: near 10 cm. Maximum wind gusts: northwest 70 km/h. Locations: Hopedale and vicinity. Time span: continuing until this evening. Remarks: Fresh snowfall combined with strong northwesterly winds will continue to give reduced visibility in blowing snow, which will persist through the day today. The snow will taper off this evening and winds will subside tonight. ### Travel is expected to be hazardous due to reduced visibility. Blowing snow advisories are issued when winds are expected to create blowing snow giving poor visibility to 800 metres or less for at least 3 hours. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2021-01-30T22:59:47-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-01-30T14:38:47-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3843337279.2021
Area: Hopedale and vicinity
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Special Air Quality Statement Ended
properties.Summary:
Description: Elevated pollution levels are no longer expected or have moved out of the area. ###
